title: #19 of June 2018 Grade 12 - Natural Sciences CSAT (Korean SAT) Mock test
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(p)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the number of common tangent lines of two parabolas "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=2y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left(y+\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^2 = 4px."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find a real number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that satisfies "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \lim_{p\to k^{+}}f(p) > f(k)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is expected that you solve this in 10 minutes. "}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of <Grade 12 CSAT Mock test> series.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's slowly decrease "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when it's a positive number."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We need to have a discontinuity in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(p)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where, right past a certain value it should output a value higher than before."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That certain value is obviously when the two parabolas are tangent to each other."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However note that decreasing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" means "expanding" the parabola."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then, after being tangent, the function value is smaller, because now the two parabolas intersect without being tangent to each other."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since this is impossible, let's slowly decrease "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when it's a negative number."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Again we need to have a discontinuity in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(p)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where, right past a certain value it should output a value higher than before, that certain value is blablabla."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that decreasing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" now means "shrinking" the parabola. (Because the "},{"type":"text","text":"absolute value","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" increases.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, after being tangent, the function value is larger, because now the two parabolas don't intersect with each other."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we're looking for is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p<0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that the two parabolas are tangent to each other."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the point of tangency be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\alpha,~\beta)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then, from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha^2=2\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left(\beta+\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^2=4k\alpha,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\alpha^2+1)^2 = 16k\alpha."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Nextly, the parabola "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=2y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfies "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{dy}{dx} = x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the parabola "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left(y+\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^2=4kx"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfies "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{4k}{2y+1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha=\dfrac{4k}{2\beta+1}=\dfrac{4k}{\alpha^2+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4k=\alpha(\alpha^2+1)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\alpha^2+1)^2 = 16k\alpha = 4\alpha^2(\alpha^2+1) \\
\alpha^2+1 = 4\alpha^2 \\
\alpha = -\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{3}}~(\because\,\alpha<0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=\dfrac{\alpha(\alpha^2+1)}{4}=\boxed{-\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{9}}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: #19 of Sept 2015 Grade 10 CSAT (Korean SAT) Mock test
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a quartic, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the remainder of the division "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)\div (x-a)(x-b)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which of the followings are true?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"~f(a)-R(a)=0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"~f(a)-R(b)=f(b)-R(a)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"~af(b)-bf(a)=(a-b)R(0)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of <Grade 10 CSAT Mock test> series.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=(x-a)(x-b)Q(x)+R(x),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(a)=R(a)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore~\boxed{\text{TRUE}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(a)=R(a),~f(b)=R(b)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation holds when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(a)=f(b),"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which does not make any sense."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore~\boxed{\text{FALSE}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R(x)=px+q."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R(0)=q,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"af(b)-bf(a)=aR(b)-bR(a)=abp+aq-abp-bq=aq-bq=(a-b)q=(a-b)R(0)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore~\boxed{\text{TRUE}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the followings, only "},{"type":"text","text":"A","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"text","text":"C","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" are correct."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 19th Phibonacci number
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n_{1}<n_{2}<n_{3}< ..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be solutions to the equation:
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi(n)=\phi(n-1)+\phi(n-2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"text","text":"Euler's Totient Function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n_{19}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I had a hunch the answer would be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2017"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". :)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I initially wondered if all such "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would be prime, but as we go up the list "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1037"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1541"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are composite, and it is noted in the OEIS link that the incidence of composites increases as the list goes on. It's also curious that all known Fermat primes are in this list.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Is this solvable by hand? I find solving it manually a huge pain (and waste of time).

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"
